Who was the best emperor of Rome?

I believe the best emperor to be Trajan.
While going through the emperors of Rome, Trajan stood out to me as the best because he was honorable, he expanded the Roman Empire, and he cared for the people of Rome. Usually when talking about Roman Emperors you will see murder, envy, or arrogance from them, but this is not the case with Trajan. Dio Cassius, a statesman of Rome, even praises Trajan for his honor and how he neither feared nor hated anyone. He has done a lot for Rome, such as expending vast sums for wars and peace, all while not draining anyone’s blood. This is a big accomplishment when compared to other emperors and their stories of murder.

Fun Facts About Trajan

  • His birth name was Marcus Ulpius Traianus
  • Trajan's column still stands in modern-day Rome
  • He was the thirteenth Roman Emperor and the second of the Five Good Emperors

Military Campaigns by Trajan in Chronological Order

  1. Conquest of Dacia
  2. Nabataean annexation
  3. Parthian campaign
  4. Kitos war

Roman Imperial Dynasties

Name Period
Nerva 96–98
Trajan 98–117
Hadrian 117–138
Antoninus Pius 138–161
Lucius Verus 161–169
Marcus Aurelius 161–180
Commodus 177–192
